name: Beat
description: Emerged in the early 1960s in the United Kingdom, drawing on Rock & Roll and the late 1950s Skiffle revival in a simple guitar-band format with strong melodies.

children.name: Freakbeat
children.description: Outgrowth of the Mod movement which combines elements of British Rhythm & Blues and Beat with studio effects common in Psychedelia such as fuzztones, flanging and chorus; often seen as a British relative of the American Garage Psych scene.

children.name: Freakbeat
children.description: Outgrowth of the Mod movement which combines elements of British Rhythm & Blues and Beat with studio effects common in Psychedelia such as fuzztones, flanging and chorus; often seen as a British relative of the American Garage Psych scene.

children.name: Group Sounds
children.description: Japanese bands in the mid-to-late 1960s who began performing a style of Beat primarily in English.

children.name: Group Sounds
children.description: Japanese bands in the mid-to-late 1960s who began performing a style of Beat primarily in English.

children.name: Jovem Guarda
children.description: 1960s Brazilian youth-oriented Pop Rock, with romantic lyrics and influenced by Merseybeat and Rockabilly.

children.name: Jovem Guarda
children.description: 1960s Brazilian youth-oriented Pop Rock, with romantic lyrics and influenced by Merseybeat and Rockabilly.

children.name: Merseybeat
children.description: Light, highly melodic style of Beat popular in the UK during the early 1960s, named due to the abundance of bands from Liverpool beside the River Mersey.

children.name: Merseybeat
children.description: Light, highly melodic style of Beat popular in the UK during the early 1960s, named due to the abundance of bands from Liverpool beside the River Mersey.

children.name: Nederbeat
children.description: Dutch answer to the British Beat boom of the 1960s.
